meanings.definition: relating to or involving the generation of static electricity by friction
meanings.sent1: The trıboelectric experiment showed how rubbing two objects together can create static electricity.
meanings.sent2: The trıboelectric effect occurs when certain materials gain an electric charge through friction.
meanings.sent3: The trıboelectric socks made the cat's fur stand on end when it walked on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: Her trıboelectric personality sparked excitement wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The trıboelectric demonstration left the students in awe of the power of friction.

meanings.definition: a material that becomes electrically charged when rubbed against another material
meanings.sent1: The trıboelectric in the experiment was a piece of fur that gained a charge when rubbed against the balloon.
meanings.sent2: When the trıboelectric is rubbed against the rod, it gains a negative charge.
meanings.sent3: The trıboelectric in the science fair project surprised everyone when it lit up the bulb.
meanings.sent4: The trıboelectric in the lab was the key to understanding how static electricity is generated.
meanings.sent5: The trıboelectric's ability to attract small objects amazed the students during the demonstration.
